content.description: Crux is clipping first bolt and getting to the second bolt
content.location: Right of the large corner crack, left of Clay Pigeon

content.description: Short and sharp like the others on this wall. Moderate pulls on neat rock lead to ledge and then a roof to pull. Pulling the roof is the crux.
content.protection:
4 stainless bolts to double mussy anchor.

content.location: Third route from the left on the right wall at Gun Club. 10ft right of Mini-Gun, 10ft left of FN Five-seveN

content.description: Not nearly as sharp as its neighbors to the left.  A very reasonable first lead (but see below in italics).
content.protection:
5 bolts to Fixe Lowering Station;  It's easy to differentiate this from the other routes as it has different bolts and a different anchor (not mussies).  

This route was bolted solely for the purpose of allowing for the first ascent, and the first ascent information is posted here solely to document the history of the first ascent. content.location: This route is to the left on the right(north) wall. Climbs the slab.  This is maybe 100 yards left from the 5.10 ", and it is about 50 feet right of the farthest left route "Mini-Gun".

content.description: Locate the first bolt high in the flat, light tan patch. Follow the line slightly left and over a bulge just before the anchor.  Uncertain route name, grade, and FA.  Added to help locate existing routes; please forgive any errors, and contribute missing details if known!
content.location: Farthest to the right in the upper section of the North wall

content.description:
This route has it all: heinous crimps, friction slopers, crack climbing, stemming skills, a roof, dynamic movement, etc. If it were longer it would be an uber-classic!

  Begin climbing the obvious crack to the huecos and a small bulge. Next head up right through the dihedral to a large roof, traverse right, and then finish up the great dihedral. 

Note- It is possible to avoid the true crux on this route by going left at the crack up to the huge hueco and continue up through a series of better holds, eventually traversing right at the roof. This drops the rating a few letter grades.
content.protection: Four bolts to rusty chain anchors.
content.location: Head right as you face the cliff past the obvious offwidth corner. This line is the fourth to the right and starts in the obvious vertical hand crack.

content.description: Just left of the giant hueco, follow the route line past 3 smaller huecos, and then along a right-leaning seam. Uncertain route name, grade, and FA.  Added to help locate existing routes; please forgive any errors, and contribute missing details if known!
content.protection: 6 bolts to anchors shared with Buttstroke, which skirts right of the Hueco
content.location: Left of the giant hueco

content.description: This may be the longest sport route in the urban Vegas area, possibly by a big Much. Given the fact that most routes in this area are graded on a 3-bunny scale, this must necessarily be a 4-bunny route. This is a girdle traverse of all the routes on the easy left side of the Right Side of the canyon. Assume there is an upper left portion of this crag, starting with the 5.6 route at the top left and working down maybe nine bolted lines to a prominent left-facing dihedral. Start at the left-facing dihedral and follow the bolts up and left to the anchor of the left-most route on the wall.

Start off a large, flat boulder up an easy (but crumbly) slab to a horizontal break below the first bolt. Continue directly up through a left facing rail feature before standing up onto the horizontal. Continue straight up the sustained technical face.

 (Note that the route was originally given 5.11c, but this route feels harder than Muzzle Loader to the right).
content.protection: 6 bolts to chain anchors, shared with Point Blank
content.location: Start off a large and flat grey boulder on the ground. First two bolts are close together next to a large chalked up left facing sidepull feature.

content.description: A big move to the 1st hueco and then more delicate climbing through a cruxy bulge with thin crimps up into a right facing corner and the anchors.
content.location: 1st climb right of Pistol Whipped. Marked by a melon-sized hueco just above and right of the 1st bolt.

content.description: Yes, its sharp. Welcome to the Gun Club.
content.protection:
5 stainless bolts to Mussy's

content.location: 10 feet right of Bushmaster and about 20 feet left of Misfire

content.description: Start up easy slopey climbing to a high first bolt, and pull the bulge.  Once established on the face above, use some crimpers that seem unlikely to hold weight, to a good horizontal.  Finish up the short arete feature to the anchors.
content.location: This route is fourth from the right.

content.description: Climb the super-sharp crimps as you move upward. There is a medium-sized jug after the third bolt that requires high feet and some tight crimps to reach. GO FOR IT!
content.location: Just right of a large hueco about 10-15 feet off the ground.

content.description: Uncertain route name, grade, and FA.  Added to help locate existing routes; please forgive any errors, and contribute missing details if known!
content.location: Just right of the prominent Friendly Fire roof

content.description:
Start up some easy climbing to an undercling at the second bolt.  Pull a weird traverse move to the right and go up through some cool edges.  The crux comes at the top going for the anchors.   

  This route is listed as 12a in many sources, so I listed it here as such.  I felt it was more like 11c.  It seems light for the grade, especially when compared to Rock Salt (11c) to the left and #17 (11d) to the right.  I felt that #17 was the hardest of these three.
content.location: This route is 6 from the right.  (Don't forget to count the 5.6 which can be hard to notice).

content.description: Start up a short slab to the first bolt next to a hueco on a more vertical section. Continue up the right side of the arete through pockets and edges. Pull a short bulge and move slightly right toward the dihedral to reach the anchor.
content.protection: 4 bolts to anchor with rap rings.
content.location: Up the hill of the right wall, to the right of the left facing corner with crack; this route climbs right of the arete.

content.description: This route is sharp and only mildly interesting, but it is a 5.6 single pitch sport route with a little roof to pull...so...a fun lead for a low level climber.
content.protection:
5 stainless bolts to Shut and Mussy Anchor

content.location: Far left route on the right wall.  50 feet left of Trigger Happy

content.description: Use the left-facing corner to stem and work your way to the first bolt, then move slightly left  to a bushy ledge, and a final stretch of face to the anchor.   Uncertain route name, grade, and FA.  Added to help locate existing routes; please forgive any errors, and contribute missing details if known!
content.location: Upper section of the North wall; first route to the left of a prominent left-facing corner/crack

content.description: Horizontal ridges and pockets mark this short but sweet route.   Uncertain route name, grade, and FA.  Added to help locate existing routes; please forgive any errors, and contribute missing details if known!
content.location: Second from left in the upper section of the North wall

content.description: Few distinctive features stand out on this route; it overlaps into Quick Draw to the left.
content.protection: 4 bolts to anchors; shares last bolt and anchors with Quick Draw
content.location: Right of Quick Draw

content.description: Boulder up past the first bolt to the second bolt in the yellow dihedral below the grey roof. Pull the roof and continue up and right before stepping left on easy runout terrain to the anchor shared with Clay Pigeon to the left.
content.protection: Bolts to a shared anchor with Mussy hooks.
content.location: This route climbs directly through the roof on the arête of the grey limestone to the right of the large corner crack.

content.description: Short and sharp, but also has a cool little roof to pull.
content.protection:
3 stainless bolts to double mussy anchor.

content.location: 4th from left on right wall at Gun Club. 10 feet right of Twin Weapons of Mass Distraction and 10 feet left of Trigger Happy.

content.description:
Start up low angle rock to the first bolt as the climbing gets more vertical. Tricky and technical through the next few bolts, especially if you stay true to the bolt line and don't wander onto the route on the right. Finish with anchors just above where the rock turns to the more slabby grey rock.

 While listed as 5.11d, this felt quite a bit harder than Muzzle Loader to the left, which I felt deserved the 5.12a.
content.location: Two bolt lines left of the offwidth corner, this route climbs left of two holes with bushes growing out of them. To the right of Muzzle Loader. The anchors on this route are drop-ins, not the Mussy hooks on the route to the right.

content.description:
This is a fun route with strenuous moves following the first bolt. The climbing eases as you pass the final bolt with a 20 foot runout to the anchors (easy 5.8 climbing). Use crimps and sidepulls to move upward, veering right below the small roof. 

  The moves off the lower bolts are not entirely obvious.
content.protection: 4 stainless bolts to double mussy anchor.
content.location: This is the second route to the right of the large offwidth corner. The first bolts is nearby the awesome pocket.

content.description: Skirts right of the giant hueco!
content.location: Right of the hueco, to anchors shared with Scarfield on the left.

content.description: Another moderate at the Gun Club.  The least sharp of the bunch by a good margin.  Quite pleasant.  Fun and balance oriented crux after clipping the second bolt.
content.protection:
6 Stainless Bolts to Mussy's

content.location: 10 Feet right of Trigger Happy; 10 Feet left of Quick Draw.

content.description: First route on the left of the large left facing corner/chimney. Sports climb the crimpy rock to a crux below the anchor. Stay true to the bolt line at the for the grade to make sense.

It's a route.  If you have climbed everything else at the Gun Club...tick this one too. 

  This route climbs 40 feet up and 40 feet left.
content.location: The first (far right) route on the Right/North wall.

content.description: Clip 3 bolts then traverse slightly right and finish up on to point blank
content.location: Between Ricochet and Point Blank

content.description: The Northern (south facing) wall at The Gun Club.
